author: Universal Pictures
description:
Beca (Anna Kendrick) and the Bellas face off in a high-energy riff battle — but this time, their a cappella charm gets outshined by full-on bands. 

Buy/Rent Pitch Perfect 3!

Now graduated from college and out in the real world where it takes more than a cappella to get by, all the Bellas return in the final chapter in the beloved series. After the highs of winning the World Championships, the Bellas find themselves split apart and discovering there are no
title: Mic Drop Gone Wrong🎤😬 #PitchPerfect3 #Shorts

author: Universal Pictures
description: How to train your dragon? We can’t help with that... but we can help train the next-gen film crew! Our Universal Below-the-Line Traineeship took 11 amazing trainees from Accounting, Assistant Director, Camera and Costume to Locations, Props, Sound, Sustainability and VFX, giving them real-world skills and mentorship. A big shoutout to Northern Ireland Screen and Film London for helping us find these rising stars! Watch now to see how we’re shaping the future of film!
title: Universal Below-The-Line Traineeship | How To Train Your Dragon

author: Universal Pictures
title: They do have a point | 🎬 Ted 2 (2015)

author: Universal Pictures
description:
How To Train Your Dragon - In Theaters Now

From three-time Oscar® nominee and Golden Globe winner Dean DeBlois, the creative visionary behind DreamWorks Animation’s acclaimed How to Train Your Dragon trilogy, comes a stunning live-action reimagining of the film that launched the beloved franchise. 

On the rugged isle of Berk, where Vikings and dragons have been bitter enemies for generations, Hiccup (Mason Thames; The Black Phone, For All Mankind) stands apart. The inventive yet overlooked son of Chief Stoick the Vast (Gerard Butler, reprising his voice role from the animated franchise), Hiccup defies centuries of tradition when he befriends Toothless, a feared Night Fury dragon. Their unlikely bond reveals the true nature of dragons, challenging the very foundations of Viking society. 

With the fierce and ambitious Astrid (BAFTA nominee Nico Parker; Dumbo, The Last of Us) and the village’s quirky blacksmith Gobber (Nick Frost; Snow White and the Huntsman, Shaun of the Dead) by his
title: How To Train Your Dragon | Thriving Together
